question: If <katex>$\Delta ABC$</katex> is right angled at C, then the value of <katex>$tan~A+tan~B$</katex> is
explanation: In a right triangle at C, <katex>$A+B=90^{\circ}$</katex>, so <katex>$\tan B = \cot A$</katex>.
<katex>$\tan A + \cot A = \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} + \frac{\cos A}{\sin A} = \frac{\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A}{\sin A \cos A} = \frac{1}{\sin A \cos A}$</katex>.
Using sides: <katex>$\tan A = a/b, \tan B = b/a$</katex>. Sum <katex>$= \frac{a}{b} + \frac{b}{a} = \frac{a^2+b^2}{ab} = \frac{c^2}{ab}$</katex>.
